alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Shackelford; Throckmorton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 7:14PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT HASKELL...JONES...SHACKELFORD... SOUTHEASTERN FISHER AND THROCKMORTON COUNTIES THROUGH 815 PM CDT... At 713 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms that extended from northern Haskell County to southeastern Fisher County, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Haskell, Stamford, Anson, Albany, Throckmorton, Rule, Hawley, Lueders, Rochester, Moran, Weinert, O`Brien, Irby, Noodle, Paint Creek, Ibex, Avoca, Millers Creek Reservoir, Fort Griffin, and Neinda. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for west central Texas.
